sen.j: 篠田芥津（しのだ かいしん、男性、文政4年（1821年） – 明治35年（1902年））は、明治時代に京都で活躍した日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Kaishin SHINODA (male, 1821-1902) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) who was active in Kyoto in the Meiji period.
Kaishin SHINODA (male, 1821-1902) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) who was active in Kyoto in the Meiji period.
Kaishin SHINODA (male, 1821-1902) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) who was active in Kyoto in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 名は徳、字は六吉、直心、崇夫、芥津は号 (称号)である。
sen.e: His name was Toku, azana (adult male's nickname) were Rokkichi, Jikishin and Takao, and Kaishin was a second name or alias.
sen.cmt: 「徳」「六吉、直心、崇夫」は読み方不明。
sen.e: His name was Toku, his azana (adult male's nickname) were Rokkichi, Jikishin and Takao, and Kaishin was his pseudonym.
His name was Toku, his azana (adult male's nickname) were Rokkichi, Jikishin and Takao, and Kaishin was his pseudonym.

sen.j: 美濃国芥水村の人。
sen.e: He was from Kaisuimura, Mino Province.
He was from Kaisuimura, Mino Province.
He was from Kaisuimura, Mino Province.

sen.j: 安部井櫟堂に師事して篆刻を学んだ。
sen.e: He learned seal engraving under Rekido ABEI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He learned seal engraving under Rekido ABEI.
He learned seal engraving under Rekido ABEI.

sen.j: また鈴木風越（1816年 - 1886年）の門人ともいう。
sen.e: He is also said to have been the disciple of Fuetsu SUZUKI (1816-1886).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He is also said to have been a disciple of Fuetsu SUZUKI (1816-1886).
He is also said to have been a disciple of Fuetsu SUZUKI (1816-1886).

sen.j: 秦漢の古印の法に則り、文彭・何震の印法に従った。
sen.e: He followed the inho (sealing way) of Wen PENG and He ZHENG based on the old type style of Qin-Han.
He followed the inho (sealing way) of Wen PENG and He ZHENG, conforming to the old style of Qin-Han.
sen.cmt: 動詞変更、type削除しました。
sen.e: He followed the inho (sealing way) of Wen PENG and He ZHENG, conforming to the old style of Qin-Han.

sen.j: 舶載された清国からの印籍などに影響され、中国の篆刻家一覧の作風を取り入れている。
sen.e: Having been influenced by the books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal) shipped from Qing, he adopted the styles of Chinese tenkokuka.
Having been influenced by the books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal) shipped from Qing, he adopted the styles of Chinese tenkokuka.
Having been influenced by the books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal) shipped from Qing, he adopted the styles of Chinese tenkokuka.

sen.j: その篆書体秦の八体・新の六体関連は非常に癖があったので「芥津の撥文字」といわれた。
sen.e: His tensho-tai (seal-engraving style of writing Chinese characters) related to 八体・新の六体 was very unique which was called 'Kaishin's hatsu character.'
sen.cmt: 「秦」と「八体・新の六体」は意味がわかりませんでした。前者は省略し、後者は日本語のまま訳文に挿入しました。
sen.e: His tensho-tai (seal-engraving style of writing Chinese characters) related to 八体・新の六体 was very unique and was called 'Kaishin's hatsu character.'
His tensho-tai (seal-engraving style of writing Chinese characters) related to 八体・新の六体 was very unique and was called 'Kaishin's hatsu character.'

sen.j: はじめ江戸に出て篆刻家として一家をなしてから京都に移り柳馬場に住んだ。
sen.e: First he went to Edo and became a fully-fledged tenkokuka, and then moved to Kyoto and lived in Yanaginobanba.
First he went to Edo and became a fully-fledged tenkokuka, and then moved to Kyoto to live in Yanaginobanba.
sen.cmt: andの繰り返しの回避しました。
sen.e: First he went to Edo and became a fully-fledged tenkokuka, and then moved to Kyoto to live in Yanaginobanba.

sen.j: 明治天皇の御印や三条実美らの名流の印を多く刻している。
sen.e: He carved many seals for famous people including oshirushi (seal used by the imperial family) for Meiji Emperor and seals for Sanetomi SANJO and others.
He carved many seals for famous people including oshirushi (seal used by the Imperial family) for Meiji Emperor and seals for Sanetomi SANJO.
sen.cmt: and othersの削除、大文字化しました。
sen.e: He carved many seals for famous people including oshirushi (seal used by the Imperial family) for Meiji Emperor and seals for Sanetomi SANJO.

sen.j: 門戸を叩く者が後を断たなかった。
sen.e: Many people wanted to learn under him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many people wanted to learn under him.
Many people wanted to learn under him.

sen.j: しかし、河井荃廬・河井章石兄弟などほんの数人だけを門人として許した。
sen.e: However, he approved only a few of them to become disciples such as the brothers of Senro KAWAI and Shoseki KAWAI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he approved only a few of them to become disciples such as the brothers of Senro KAWAI and Shoseki KAWAI.
However, he approved only a few of them to become disciples such as the brothers of Senro KAWAI and Shoseki KAWAI.

sen.j: 中国の『広印人伝』に「性豪逸、多奇行」と紹介されている。
sen.e: In China's 'Koinjinden,' he is introduced as a person of '性豪逸、多奇行.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「性豪逸、多奇行」の正確な意味がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: In 'Koinjinden' in China, he is introduced as a person of '性豪逸、多奇行.'
In 'Koinjinden' in China, he is introduced as a person of '性豪逸、多奇行.'

sen.j: 異常に几帳面な人でキチンとしていないと気が済まなかった。
sen.e: He was extremely organized and wanted to have everything neat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was extremely organized and wanted to have everything neat.
He was extremely organized and wanted to have everything neat.

sen.j: たとえば道を歩くときは必ず真ん中を歩き、直角に曲がる。
sen.e: For example, when he walked he had to walk on the center of the road and when he turned it had to be at a right angle.
For example, when he walked, he had to walk on the center of the road and turn at a right angle.
For example, when he walked, he had to walk on the center of the road and turn at a right angle.

sen.j: 寝具の位置は畳の目数で測って決めていて寸分もずらさない。
sen.e: Where his bedding (bedclothes) was placed was determined precisely by counting the number of the patterns of the tatami mat, which was kept very strictly.
The position of his bedclothes was determined precisely by counting the number of the grain of a tatami mat, which was kept very strictly.
sen.cmt: 繰り返しの回避、畳の目の表現変更しました。
sen.e: The position of his bedclothes was determined precisely by counting the number of the grain of a tatami mat, which was kept very strictly.

sen.j: 家の門から道までの歩数を決めていて、これが合わないと何度でも繰り返した。
sen.e: He had determined the number of footsteps from the gate of his home to the road, and he kept going back and forth between his house and the road until he could reach the road with the right number of footsteps.

He determined the number of footsteps from the gate of his house to a road, and he kept going back and forth between his house and the road until he could reach the road with the right number of footsteps.

He determined the number of footsteps from the gate of his house to a road, and he kept going back and forth between his house and the road until he could reach the road with the right number of footsteps.

sen.j: 李白の書幅「古柏行」の行書の文字を一字一字切り離してまっすぐに表具し直して床に掛けていた、などなど。
sen.e: He cut each of the letters of 'A Song of an Old Cypress' written by Li Po (Rihaku) in gyosho (a style of handwriting) and lined them straight to hang on the wall.
He cut each of the letters of 'A Song of an Old Cypress' written by Li Po (Rihaku) in gyosho (a style of handwriting) and mount them with lining them straight to hang on the wall.
sen.cmt: 「表具」が抜けていたので補完しました。
sen.e: He cut each of the letters of 'A Song of an Old Cypress' written by Li Po (Rihaku) in gyosho (a style of handwriting) and mount them with lining them straight to hang on the wall.

sen.j: これらの行動から強迫性障害が疑われる。
sen.e: These actions indicate that he had an obsessive-compulsive disorder.
These actions indicate that he might have an obsessive-compulsive disorder.
These actions indicate that he might have an obsessive-compulsive disorder.

sen.j: 印譜
sen.e: Inpu (compilation of seal marks)
Inpu (compilation of seal marks)
Inpu (compilation of seal marks)

sen.j: 『一日六時恒吉祥草堂印譜』1901年
sen.e: "Ichijiturokujikokisshosodo Inpu" (1901)
"Ichijiturokujikokisshosodo Inpu" (1901)
"Ichijiturokujikokisshosodo Inpu" (1901)
